fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes

Interface ITemplateFunction


  • @PluginService
public interface ITemplateFunction
    Custom template functions can implement this interface and register the implementation as an OSGi service. Template systems can integrate these functions by tracking OSGi services.

    Template systems are not required to implement functions. The function may provide different names for different template systems.

    Functions that require require access to the HTTP call context should instead implement IHttpTemplateFunction. However, such functions cannot be used in other contexts (such as generating files or e-mails).

    If multiple template functions are defined with identical names, then the template system should select the function to apply as follows:

    1. try to select implementations of IHttpTemplateFunction in preference to implementations of ITemplateFunction.
    2. try to select the function with the highest service ranking.
    3. try to select the function with the highest service ID.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access. Immutability is preferred.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IHttpTemplateFunction

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object execute(List<?> arguments)
      Invokes the function from a template with an argument list.
      String getName(String forTemplateSystemName)
      Gets the preferred name of the function, which can vary according to the name of the template system if necessary.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName(String forTemplateSystemName)
        Gets the preferred name of the function, which can vary according to the name of the template system if necessary.
        Parameters:
        forTemplateSystemName - the name of the template system, which will be implementation-dependent.
        Returns:
        the function name as appropriate for the named template system. This can vary, but can also be constant. If null, empty, or containing unsupported characters, the template system may ignore this function and should log some debugging information to help resolve any such problem.
        Since:
        1.0

      • execute

        Object execute(List<?> arguments)
        Invokes the function from a template with an argument list.
        Parameters:
        arguments - list of arguments. May be empty. Where possible, the template system will provide "unwrapped" objects and not objects within system-specific wrappers.
        Returns:
        an object or null, as appropriate for the template.
        Since:
        1.0
